notes: added a structuredClone polyfill to fix a breaking error on Chromium 95 (OBS 27)
fixed badges not rendering properly if the gradient blending mode is plus-lighter on Chromium 95 (OBS 27)
plus-lighter wasn't a valid option until Chromium 100
added a timezone array polyfill to fix a breaking error on Chromium 95 (OBS 27)
fixed 7TV name paints not applying if a custom paint is present, but the viewer wants their 7TV paint to override it
this was literally just flip-flopping the order of 2 function calls lol
added a toggle to switch to a more traditional chat layout flow
made back-to-back messages being combined into one overall block optional
fixed unicode emoji breaking stored Twitch emote names
(update only contains new settings)
fixed BeatLeader avatars not showing up on initialization of the overlay if no map is being played at the time of initialization
added the ability to add additional padding to the health outline
seeing some confusion about the health outline and progress outline being in the same spot showing similar things, hopefully this differentiates it enough?
added a BeatLeader icon option for rank icon display
fixed vertical alignment issue with BeatLeader icons and avatars in the Personal Best cell
added the ability to display ranked and curation status lines akin to status lines on BeatSaver map cards
fixed personal best cell reappearing on layout change even if a personal best was not set and the setting to hide it if so was enabled
fixed incorrect state check in Twitch oauth token fetching
this might? fix auth errors for one particular streamer? (sorry xav, hopefully this fixes it)
moderators and VIPs can now bypass ASCII art filtering
messages shorter than 3 characters now bypass ASCII art filtering
(update only contains new settings)
failing while playing a map will now add an icon indicating failure on top of the cover art
fixed a duplicate CSS variable name
added the ability to display personal bests from BeatLeader
added the ability to shift perspective of the overlay as a whole
fixed default subscriber badges not reflecting their proper subscription amount
fixed default bits badges not showing up
removed old badge show/hide code and migrated toggles to CSS definitions
i broke toggles in the shared chat refactor, they now work again. sorry! didn't catch it until recently
fixed non-twitch emotes in cheer messages doubling as their text form
fixed new subscribers who haven't chatted in a session yet triggering a non-breaking undefined exception
this is so specific that i probably just caught a rare event happening lol, that never happens
fixed setting cell labels with multiple lines not being vertically centered
prevented viewers' personal 7TV emote sets from appearing in the overlay and modifying the channel's active emote sets, unless toggled on
dynamic emote create/remove events now ensure it's only affecting emote sets mirroring the event's attached emote set ID
this only affects BTTV and 7TV. no live data interface/endpoint exists for FFZ
added a setting to switch BTTV emote formats between GIF/PNG and WEBP
by default it will now use WEBP. was completely unaware this format was supported on there woops
fixed 7TV paints not setting if the broadcaster disables individuality settings on name blocks, but still allows 7TV paints
(update only contains new settings)
ensured all overlays now use shared asset paths
added support for "Gigantify an Emote" message effects
most of the other implementations i've seen of this effect also enlarge text, so the whole message will enlarge on the overlay. not just the emote
fixed twitch badges remaining visible in viewer information even after the viewer or twitch has removed them
badge blocks in viewer information are now separated per-chatroom in shared chats
badges are now forced to render in a specific order, no matter how they're ordered in the DOM
fixed avatars not rendering even if a cheering threshold was met
removing all of the else if's in the avatarEnabled getter fixed this and i'm... yeah. i'm clueless. no idea.
completely overhauled emote rendering
this should pretty much completely fix zero-width emotes, there were originally 5 bugs in the changelog concerning zero-width emotes, but completely re-doing it fixed all of those + more. so.
added a setting to manually adjust vertical offsets of inline emotes
changed default 7TV emote format from GIF/PNG to WEBP
discovered during testing that GIFs don't quite render opacity correctly compared to WEBP and AVIF
fixed reply bodies remaining highlighted if the message being replied to was highlighted
attempted to fix initial system messages sometimes failing to decay
i've only seen this come up a few times, ever? i think what i moved around should fix it.
(update only contains new settings)
fixed emote-only replies cutting off the lower half of emotes if big emotes are enabled
reworked how twitch emotes are handled internally
they're now being treated much more similarly to emotes on external services
fixed zero-width emotes not rendering as zero-width emotes
zero-width emotes no longer count towards emote limits in big emote messages
emotes cached URL objects are now cleared when toggling the low quality images setting
removed some old commented out code
(hotfix @ 19:02 CST) fixed emotes with HTML-encoded entities not rendering
this broke "<3"
centralized all shared libraries and assets into a shared path
updated Font Awesome to version 6.6.0
updated coloris to version 0.24.0
updated FancySelect to version 0.7.0
had to remove a conditional check to get this version working, wtf
updated markdown-it to version 14.1.0
updated obs-websocket-js to version 5.0.6
updated socket.io to version 4.8.1
ensured all overlays have access to self-hosted mirrors of Google webfonts
there were a bunch that didn't, woops
fixed health outlines not appearing due to z-index conflicts with the song progress outline
(this was silently patched on the 31st)
disabled health outline foreground color reflection by default
added icon for map characteristics added by ReBeat
can't verify if the icons show up as the mod is... very, very broken on 1.37 unfortunately. should be fine
ensured management-related chat commands are only triggerable from the broadcaster's chatroom in shared chats
added a setting to limit big emote messages by line count
added a setting to limit reply block widths
externalized badge category data
cleaned up some class functions
ty DJDavid98 for pointing some stuff out a little while back, haven't gotten around to looking at things until now
added a setting flag to indicate a default value is not needed
added a toggle to enable/disable error notifications
fixed the QR code cell remaining visible if the option to hide the overlay in the menu was enabled
(this was silently patched on the 29th, was a 2 line fix)
added health display around the cover art
added icons for map characteristics added by Chirality
fixed secondary metadata color reflecting the art color overriding the static color, even if that setting is disabled
added a setting to generate a spotify scannable code for the album the playing track is on, rather than the track itself
the "from" in album data display can now be changed
(update only contains new settings)
moved ranked pp curve data to an external JSON file
added a setting to show ranked pp amounts based on current score instead of current accuracy
added some filters for BS+'s internal art texture due to *something* using the wrong color space for image data
don't know if this is Unity or Beat Saber or BS+ or what causing this issue
fixed QR code cell showing up when loading the overlay even when no code has been generated yet
added a gradient to the QR code cell's background
added an option to add a border to the QR code cell
stats on Beat Saber request information now hide if they extend outside the message block
removed some console log spamming from the DataPuller live data endpoint
added a QR code generator for map links
went ahead and allowed QR codes, Aztec codes, and PDF417 codes. the reader i'm using seems to support these just fine at all error correction levels
fixed bug with beatleader ranked data causing null read errors on custom beat saber maps not uploaded to beatsaver
added a setting to reverse the order of user information elements
big emotes on layouts with narrow widths now wrap to the next line instead of clipping on outer edges
this was especially apparent on right-aligned layouts, but easily dismissable on left-aligned ones as it would just... look normal
added a setting to switch 7TV emote formats between GIF/PNG, WEBP, and AVIF
by default it will use GIF/PNG (this is what it's been using), AVIF seems to offer the lowest filesizes
fixed custom beat saber maps not uploaded to beatsaver causing undefined variable errors on beat saber overlays
chat badges from shared chat channels now render together with the broadcaster's badges
this did in fact require some internal rewrites, decided to just combine chat badges from all channels as needed
fixed BTTV and 7TV entitlements not applying from shared chatrooms that are not the broadcaster's own chatroom
increased default shared chat border size from 2px to 3px
flipped order of brightness and contrast filters on shared chat avatars
it's now contrast first, brightness second, defaults were adjusted
fixed global variable name re-use in external emote fetching
woops!
external emotes from shared chats can now merge with the streamer's
(update only contains new settings)
(basic) support for shared chat
still figuring out how i'm gonna get sub badges for messages not from the broadcaster, may require some small internal rewrites. FFZ does it, so it's possible
currently thinking maybe making separate badge blocks that render depending on what channel the message comes from, and adding broadcaster IDs to subs/bits badge objects. simplest solution i think
(update only contains new settings)
messages being replied to now hide the message being replied to if it was deleted, or if the user was timed out or banned
this was an oversight, my bad!
attempted to fix avatar display not updating if the viewer starts a subscription
fixed beat saber request information never displaying if the stream did not start in the beat saber category
if someone !bsr's and the overlay detects you're not in the beat saber category, it will trigger a stream info update so long as it's been 5 minutes since the last one
added support for showing artist images beside artist names
fixed secondary metadata field remaining blank if album metadata is toggled off while it's visible
fixed secondary metadata field getting stuck once done scrolling if album metadata is disabled
gradient on the artist field no longer stretches across the entire element, but will now apply to each individual artist
this was actually a by-product of the artist image addition, but it really improves legibility too so i'm calling this a feature and not a bug lol
spotify artist data schema is now an array of objects rather than an array of strings
i've put in a failsafe on the frontend code in case bridge scripts/plugins for external media players don't update and are still using only strings
spotify image data is now stored in a CacheStorage object
artists have a good chance of getting requested multiple times now. think it's about time to do the optimize of thingies
message body elements are now cloned to a not-visible container for use in reply elements
should allow emotes to always render in replies if the reply is from a message that has decayed already
removed additional font weight on mentions in chat messages from viewers that have custom name settings
actually fixed the badge container not disappearing when all badges were hidden/clipped this time
removed a debug console log woops
new overlay that shows current blood glucose levels mirrored from a Nightscout instance
this is kinda just meant moreso for me, but i'm including it in the public suite in case anyone else is struggling to find an overlay for this lol
(update only contains new settings / framework stuff for the Nightscout overlay)
also, nice!
fixed badge element clipping sometimes not hiding the container element
fixed badges not re-appearing if the width of the overlay increases at any point
slightly extended margins between art and stats displays in !bsr requests
added display of map age to !bsr chat requests
fixed replying to !bsr chat requests resulting in a blank message in the reply body
added a tab for !bsr chat request settings
added the ability to show rating percentage display in !bsr chat requests
lowered default minimum BeatSaver account age threshold for map information display from 180 days to 90 days
map information for !bsr requests can now be hidden on new maps
mapper information in !bsr request output can now use data provided by BeatSaver over internal map data
stats panel in !bsr request information can now be toggled on/off
stats panel elements in !bsr request information can now be toggled on/off
removed some unnecessary vertical alignment shenanigans with metadata in !bsr request information
fixed clipping and alignment issues with !bsr request information rejection messages
fixed saturation effects not being applied to international names
fixed loading stalling on new users due to some null color setting values, also ensured a fallback is set just in case
my bad my bad i sorry
HeartRateBroadcaster connections now consider not receving value updates within a timeframe as a timeout by default, rather than static connect/disconnect events
this was causing some issues with mirror scripts (namely mine) never triggering "connection lost" events, because technically, it never did lose connection
fixed ordering of the final section of chat settings in the sidebar
I comes before E right? yeah. mhm mhm
fixed renamed 7TV emotes taking on their original name instead of the new name if added mid-session
moved external emote service functions to their own separate scripts
fixed messages sticking sometimes (hopefully) (again)
changing message decay time to 0 now clears existing decay timers
added support for toggling Twitch DJ Program badges
updated organization of Twitch badges with recent events/cons/etc.
decreased default indentation of replies from 10px to 4px
added a toggle to show what name color settings will look like against default color brightness thresholds/limits
added some gradient palette presets
(update only contains new settings)
added support for HttpSiraStatus as a data source for Beat Saber-related overlays
just like BS+ and DataPuller, it too has some issues. guh
moved some global variables related to Beat Saber overlays from their individual data source scripts to the main script
fixed Beat Saber maps deleted from BeatSaver failing to display data on overlays
cleaned up the External Music Player section in the Connections tab, also added a spot for bridge scripts/media player plugins
foobar2000 is now officially supported through a bridge script utilizing foo_beefweb by the way
hid everything related to the clip overlay until further notice
stuff i was doing has been patched and i'm tired and mad and pissed fuck amazon
badge block elements now attempt to hide individual badges before outright hiding the parent container when clipping user info elements
fixed occasional flicker from user info element clipping
added support for chat message replies
adjusted a few default settings
biggest change is names no longer being capitalized by default, thought maybe names were taking up a bit *too* much space. especially with the new reply stuff
fixed custom font settings from viewers applying to mentions even if individuality settings are disabled while font reflection is on
updated Font Awesome to version 6.5.1
fixed user chat colors not applying to user objects if they're hidden
forcing oauth-tied broadcaster data fetching if the channel you're pulling information from is your own
i'm adding this on as a hotfix to the previous update
fixed multiple other dropdowns not initializing on the right setting values
fixed issues with message censoring filters becoming very trigger happy if either of the censor lists were blank, especially on numbers
added support for external music players
this currently only supports Music Player Daemon/MPD through an example bridge script, bridge scripts/player plugins must be made to support the socket connection
the MPD bridge script can be viewed at https://github.com/TheBlackParrot/stream_resource_dump/tree/main/overlays/overlay-mpd-bridge
(update only contains new settings)
added the ability to replace combo with FC acc on miss

this is currently only functional with DataPuller as the data source, ask HardCPP for an equivalent DataPuller -> LiveData/MaxScore variable if you want this with Beat Saber Plus (as it's not provided)
added a 'hands' option to element display list that shows current average pre-swing, post-swing, and accuracy scoring on both hands
this is currently only functional with DataPuller as the data source, ask HardCPP for swing average variables per-hand if you want this with Beat Saber Plus (as it's not provided)
DataPuller's hand scoring is currently buggy, these values will probably not reflect actual values at the moment (bug has been reported)
fixed some weird css overflow thing that broke metadata scrolling only on newer versions of chromium i think?
...uhhhhh? it's been fine up until i updated my dev environment the other day. /shrug
fixed vertical alignment issue when flipping combo / accuracy display
fixed blank space appearing where the ranked PP display should be upon refreshing the settings panel if a map is not ranked
made flow of mention CSS changes make a little more sense
mentions in chat messages can now reflect the name's font setting from the person being mentioned, if they've set one
fixed issue with repeating name gradients (from the chat customizer) missing the final color if it was a hard stop
7TV name paints go through different processing, those were unaffected / always worked fine
added some more 'space' to various parts of the page on mobile devices
fixed rightmost margins still applying on last-child input fields
fixed some minor various alignment issues
making sure HTTP 401 errors are specifically being handled in Spotify oauth flow
added placeholder support for non-Spotify music players through a websocket layer
this is just a placeholder for the time being, there's no functionality yet. just wanted to get some other things done first before starting on this. more to come!
moved MusicBrainz data fetching to its own separate function
moved heartrate timeout settings over to the Connections tab
fixed Beat Saber data sources showing as disconnected upon refreshing any Beat Saber-related overlay
fixed Beat Saber data source setting dropdown not properly initializing
fixed color settings not updating their swatches on initialization
fixed Beat Saber Plus connections starting upon exit of Beat Saber even if DataPuller is the selected data source, and vice versa
fixed FC display failing to initialize sometimes
simplified hit/miss and FC display code
minor positioning tweaks in ranked star display
attempted to fix extra miscellaneous info cells occasionally showing when loading a new map
ranked map data is now cached locally
defaults to 2 weeks
service icons in pp display elements now reflect Font Awesome full-width element margins
pp display is now updated when leaderboard/ranked data is refreshed
pp values are now capped between 0% and 100% accuracy values
added sanity checks to pp value calculation
the accuracy caps should address weird values too but w/e
accuracy display now forcibly rounds down to the nearest decimal place instead of rounding normally
before, 97.96% would round up to 98.0% with decimals only showing to the tenths place. it will now show 97.9% instead
fixed scaling on decaying messages not properly taking the origin point setting into account
fixed history effects not toggling on and off properly
toggling fade effects on and off are still a little weird for some reason, no idea what's causing it yet
fixed emotes within the Dingbats unicode range triggering ASCII art filters
fixed prominent avatar colors failing to set if a 'Vibrant' color was not found
moved BeatSaver cache settings into the Beat Saber section in the Connections tab
added buttons to clear Beat Saber-related cached data
fixed overlay stalling if BeatLeader or ScoreSaber leaderboard data remains null
map data now clears on receving the hash event
decimal precision on the accuracy display can now be changed
removed unused old HTTP fetch and old combo display code
added a 'pp' option to element display list that shows current PP value of ranked maps on ScoreSaber and BeatLeader
icons on the hit/miss and combo display now align themselves to the right of values if aligned to the right
calmed down logging on state change events
added setting to change animation 'divisor' on accuracy changes
the higher the value, the more time it will take for it to fall into the final accuracy value
fixed accuracy display not perfectly representing the final accuracy post-animations
this wasn't an apparent issue without the new settings, but with low enough divisors and high enough decimal precision, it became super obvious
added ranked map star rating information to miscellaneous info rotation
individual parts of the miscellaneous info display rotation can now be toggled on and off
interval of miscellaneous info rotating out can now be changed
adjusted default layout settings to accomodate new pp display
completely overhauled flow of creating and updating the user/viewer information element
this should fix the flickery-ness of user info element initialization for those that have multiple external badges too
fixed vertical alignment issue with avatars smaller than the parent container's height
avatar shape now uses percentages rather than static pixel amounts
added settings to change thresholds for refreshing BeatSaver data caches
reduced default BeatSaver map data cache expiry time from 7 days to 5 days
calmed down logging on Beat Saber state change events
another attempt at fixing deleted messages remaining up on the overlay if they're deleted during processing
fixed name colors showing up as transparent if viewers refresh their settings and allow the streamer's settings to take precedence
added icons for announcement event tags
fixed names not showing ellipsis if needed at low enough widths
fixed low width user info element culling being wonky sometimes
fixed an issue with loading settings on completely new browser sessions
fixed settings initializers mistakenly considering coloris fields as settings
fixed being unable to interact with elements underneath the notification bubble wrapper
toggling the setting to use your username over displayed name now changes the displayed name in the name preview
even more minor styling tweaks
added setting to disable successful connection notifications
timezones can now be manually overriden
swapped from javascript Date objects to Luxon DateTime objects on the local clock
had to do this for the timezone overrides
fixed timezones with an offset of 0 not displaying a sign prefix
meridiems can now be disabled in 12-hour display
more minor styling tweaks
hash checks are performed independent of map data fetching now
should prevent stalling if beatsaver's slow to respond with map data, seen this happen a few times
fixed internal cover art not loading for bs+ data endpoints
calmed console logging on beat saber event messages
emote parsing can now be filtered to ignore words or substrings, akin to the censor filter
figured some of you with the funny 'the' -> 'hte' emote might not want it to show on the overlay, or you just don't want to see a specific streamer's emotes or something
added some sanity checks on ad timer updating/values
added the ability to apply outline and shadow effects to the scannable tag's foreground content

do note this may make scannable tags harder to read, effects will be forced off if the foreground color is dark (unless the outline color matches the background) as this renders it completely unreadable
fixed black foreground color resetting to white when a new song starts
fixed both secondary metadata fields appearing occasionally when a new song starts
updated FancySelect to v0.6.1
had to add a small patch to fix a type error in a conditional check, too
fixed backup selection dropdown not working
fixed setting input checks triggering on the backup selection dropdown
added a 'hash' event to beatsaber output, triggered whenever the current map's hash changes
this is primarily for the VOD audio system as it runs on map hashes rather than any map data, i've seen it stall a couple of times waiting for beatsaver to respond with some extra data. which is bad
fixed hover CSS stuff not applying to branded icons
added quick jumps to settings in changelog messages
this has been a very long time coming, apologies
also retroactively added jumps to some previous changelog entries
some minor styling tweaks
fixed icon/text color inconsistencies in the sidebar
added mention of the new support-oriented discord server in the About page
https://discord.gg/WFbzQ4WC8Z
fixed song metadata failing to update on narrower source sizes
note to self: CSS animationend events are not as stable as they seem
replaced placeholder first time chat icon with twitch's first time chat icon
oopsie i fogor
mentions in chat messages can now reflect colors from the person being mentioned
e.g. mentioning me would color my name #CBADFF in the message, rather than only emboldening it
fixed slide-in animations retriggering every time playback state checks were triggered
i think i'm just going to end up completely re-doing display flow at some point, should be mostly fine for now
(update only contains new settings)
fixed italic fonts being forced on viewers that have applied custom chat settings if the streamer uses an italic font
fixed small vertical alignment issue in the user info container
messages from newer viewers can now be hidden until they send some amount of messages
this particular metric has been tracked for a *long* time for avatar display permissions, turning this on (it's off by default) shouldn't disrupt things
added the ability to filter messages suspected of only being ASCII art
messages containing characters from the unicode ranges for Block Elements, Box Drawing, Braille Patterns, Dingbats, and Geometric Shapes will trigger filter checks
messages flagged as a "first time chat" can now be tagged as such on the overlay
ensured messages decay if the decay timer on message elements somehow fails
added icons for cheer, resub, and new subscription event tags
message fonts can now be italicized
this was initially for a bugfix on the chat overlay, but decided to just make it a setting for viewers
added mention of the chat customization page for viewers to change their own chat settings in the Chat > Individuality section and the About section
i don't think some people know this (still) exists actually: https://theblackparrot.me/overlays/chat-customizer
separated chat filtering settings from Chat > Function into their own section
it was getting long... which you could see as a negative thing, in a sense :(
removed sensitive content warning from the Chat > Function tab
was all moved to the new Chat > Filtering tab
moved message settings in Chat > Function to Chat > Messages with the rest of the message settings
fixed overlay failing to return after resuming playback if the "Hide overlay if music is paused" setting was disabled while playback was paused
added a setting to control cover art image size
initially i forced it to double the cover art container size, but leaving it here seems kinda useless if no changes are being made to the layout
added a setting to control cover art image quality settings
moved the remote data fetching timeout setting to the main About page in the Panel Settings portion, as that applies to various non-chat related things now
meant to do this forever ago, my bad
fixed the remote data fetching timeout setting being interpreted as an integer rather than a float in various areas of code
...guh. bluh, even
force-capped the remote data fetching timeout setting between 3 and 30 seconds
enabled image smoothing on image compression/re-sizing function
fixed issue with 7tv paints not applying sometimes
this was my bad haha woops
fixed vertical alignment issue with name elements if the avatar was the tallest element
prevented emote parsing in system messages
7TV added a global emote specifically for "7TV", which shows up in the initialization messages
fixed issue with 7tv reconnections re-applying user paints even if disabled by the user
i caved and bought a 7tv sub for a month so debugging paid-for 7tv stuff should be easier now. guh
fixed 7tv badges remaining visible after they were removed on 7tv's side
worked around rare issue with song metadata not fading back in with animations due to an animation conflict
lazy fix for now, i'll look into this deeper later on
improved initialization flow for all remaining overlays
this includes: Beat Saber Stats, Beat Saber VOD Audio System, Clock, and Spotify overlays
added a check to make sure the mapper associated with a beat saber map actually exists
this appears to be an error on beatsaver's side, adding a catch in case there's more than 1 case of this happening
extended clipping fix on slanted/wide fonts from 8px to 12px
applied clipping fix to all name fonts, rather than just italicized ones
fixed clipping on extremely slanted/italicized fonts
padding fix goes brrr
fixed titles that start with numbers appearing reversed when right-aligned
fixed usernames with underscores reporting back as a non-existant user due to filtering out of said underscore characters
moved onloaded code out of a deferred script tag
fixed identity flags sometimes failing to load, causing other things to also fail to load
fixed FC display bugging out if the first block was missed
another attempt at ensuring deleted messages don't appear if they were deleted before data fetching/message prep finished
attempted to fix randomly ocurring issues involving random functions being called before initialization
fixed (sort of) effects on 0-digit pad numbers not following transparency
the current value's effects render on top of the padded numbers still, but that'll be a whole 'nother headache
tweaked pulse animation
fixed clipping on the left side of the heart icon
not fading out leading zeroes now just adds zeroes onto the displayed value
this hides the issue with effects if fading isn't wanted
fixed pre-mature firing of an "overlay loaded" event sometimes breaking the overlay
beat saber pack data is now separated from the script setting the variable for it
attempted to fix randomly occurring issues involving random functions being called before initialization
if the changes i've made here fix the issues i'm running into, all overlays will get an update similar to this later on
moved update data over to async fetch
sidebar text is now lighter than the icons beside them
should make longer lists easier to read
fixed revert button on color input fields
...i broke these at some point? idk how
most recent overlay patch notes will now also show in the about tab
made changes relating to the new test message system
fixed secondary metadata transitions triggering the slide-in animation anytime it went back to the artist
fixed art fade in/out animations applying to each individual part of itself, rather than a container
revamped test messages to a constant stream of messages from pre-defined conversations
if you'd like to be added as a sample message subject, just let me know! all i need is your twitch username
removed the test message button and replaced it with a toggle in the Debug section of Chat > Function
added data source information for album/publisher information for the spotify overlay
updated beat saber DLC pack data
buttons to refresh emote data and clear messages will now only appear if the chat overlay is active
fixed issue with new message blocks parenting to previous message blocks even if they're currently in a dismiss animation
doubled padding on name displays to fix clipping issues on italicized/skewed fonts
added negative right margin to act against added padding in name displays
experimenting with this as a fix, shouldn't be visible on left-aligned layouts but should get right-aligned ones lined up right
got overlay ready for public use
available at https://theblackparrot.me/overlays/heartrate
for details on how to set it up, see https://theblackparrot.me/overlays
added support for emitting events from HeartRateBroadcaster
twitch clip overlay status wasn't in the right spot woops
we love alphabetical order
ensured default color settings are all lowercase to avoid false positives on non-default settings checks
reworked user initialization in order to remove arbitrary delays in message parsing if the user doesn't exist yet
fixed stall issue with !refreshcosettings command
added settings (that are ENABLED by default) that will force what settings the *streamer* sets to be the default, rather than the user overrides

i've seen some people only changing part of everything you can change and thought maybe i needed some safeguards in place in case something wasn't changed from defaults, as *my* defaults would then override what the streamer sets
if you've previously set custom settings, i've already toggled all of these off for you and there's nothing extra you need to do. they'll be on by default for everyone else
fixed some strong and em tags not emboldening or italicizing text (woops)
ensured message display's enbolded font uses the base message weight
added confirmation of saving success/failure and other functions
loader spinner is now static-sized instead of dynamic-sized
variables from the old customization commands are now cleared on load, woops
moved custom user/chatter settings toggles to their own tab
felt like these might've needed to be more accessible
completely overhauled user chat customization
using commands to set chat appearance clogs up chat and confuses people that don't even know it's there, i think it's time to move this to a centralized spot and apply it globally instead
use https://theblackparrot.me/overlays/chat-customizer if you want to update URLs, the old previewer now does a 301 redirect to that URL
for now the !refreshcosettings may not show an update message, i'm running into a reeeally bizarre 12 second stall if i properly wait for the task it's doing to properly finish up
flags are now fetched from the customizer rather than hardcoded internally
fixed vertical alignment issues with some fonts on name display
added some toggles pertaining to the new chat customization options
made the dumpster fire button reload the settings panel and all overlays
man i really don't know anymore, still investigating why twitch oauth is failing
replaced the font awesome spinner with a CSS-defined one for bsr map requests
fixed emote refresh button on the settings panel failing to refresh emotes
forgot to update this long ago, woops
fixed 7TV name paints with glow effects not rendering the glow effect
added the ability to manually add to and remove from the known bot list fetched from Twitch Insights
noticed while debugging a thing that a normal person was being tagged as a bot from this list
cleaned up cheers in chat messages a bit
attempt at fixing some twitch oauth refresh failures that infinitely recurse
i'm not entirely sure what's triggering this issue (i've only ever seen it happen twice, ever, anywhere) and i can't purposefully get it to happen in my dev environment, so
re-worded the dumpster fire button on the about page
split up the chat appearance settings tab into multiple different tabs
it was getting long, sorry
outline and shadow effects are now being done through SVG filters
these should be MUCH more performant over the way they were previously being done
updated Luxon to version 3.4.4
updated jQuery to version 3.7.1
attempted to fix overlays sometimes failing to init properly due to scripts being executed out of order
(nothing specific to note)
fixed version information not properly sending to the settings panel on initial load
migrated remote database syncing ajax calls over to fetch calls
added some more maps to the goofy font filter for beat saber map requests
bsr map keys that don't exist will now show an error for map requests
added aegosexual flag to the flags command
swapped to jdecked's fork of twemoji (updated to version 15.1.0)
fixed bsr map information not showing up on the overlay if the category wasn't initially set to Beat Saber
i've also tweaked the conditional flow to allow !bsr to show up if streams are offline for debugging/configuration purposes
fixed default bit badges sometimes only rendering part of the normal 28 available badge tiers

there's some... weird oddity on some channels? idk what's going on. was testing changes in Canadian_Dragon's channel and noticed the 3 custom bit badges were all just clones of some default bit badges (the 5000, 10000, and 25000 ones to be precise)
fixed users with invalid/broken avatars rendering avatars at all
how does this even happen wtf did y'all do???
fixed system messages rendering with avatars if everyone has avatars enabled
removed viewer settings to enable/disable shadow/outline effects
i'm seeing people disable these in order to make their names harder to read. no. stop that.
tweaked UI flow a little bit, should show details after API responses now
added a loading spinner if a buffer underflow occurs
manually set the timezone abbreviation for Philippine Standard Time
was being set to "PST" which causes confusion with Pacific Standard Time, Luxon has no code for the timezone either and simply returns "GMT+8", so, manual override time yippee
added placeholder data for text fields
added a condensed "all" category for changelog entries if a change pertains to all overlays
changelog entires without a revision set in a category no longer shows "(rundefined)" as its revision
updated obs-websocket-js to version 5.0.5
decreased beatsaver stale cache time from 90 days to 7 days
not me forgetting vote counts are also in this data. nope. definitely did not forget about that
fixed various alignment issues with some non-default settings
added settings to change line heights on each cell
duration's font size now scales properly with the elapsed time's font size
added in placeholder data for some DOM elements
should be a little easier to configure without opening the game now
data fetched for beat saber map info display now comes from a CacheStorage object if present, it will also write to said storage if not present
beatsaver account's first upload must be at least 180 days old for map information to display, up from ~120 days
better clarified the "account is too new" bsr error message to reflect what it's actually looking at
beat saber map info display should now reflect chat appearance settings
fixed chat settings changed messages not showing up

...i'm gonna go out on a limb here and assume this is an issue with OBS's CEF? i couldn't replicate the issue in my dev environment. idk, this solution is just ensuring a message gets rendered at the cost of applying settings twice now. /shrug
streamers who raid in can now trigger the !clip command as if they had regular permission to do so one time
fixed cover art track progress outlines still increasing to 100% even if spotify is paused
fixed artist info displaying alongside other secondary metadata if the other secondary metadata is visible when the overlay is transitioning to a new song
this took a lot longer to fix than it seems i promise
removed some UI flow debugging lines
artist/album metadata switching intervals were wrongly being used as an integer rather than a float
removed now-extraneous beatsaver API call to fetch map collaborator data
initially collaborator data wasn't available in the 'maps/hash' endpoint, hence having to fetch it through 'maps/id' instead. but it's there now, so
beatsaver response data is now cached in a CacheStorage object rather than in SessionStorage
response data will be considered stale after 90 days
added link to my patreon page in the about panel
i have bills to pay pls to help weh
new overlay for clips/shoutouts since others bother me in various ways
available at https://theblackparrot.me/overlays/clips
moderators can use '!clip [user] [optional: index starting from 0]' or '!clip [clip URL]' to show a clip on stream, like other shoutout overlays
(update only contains new settings)
improved avatar caching, processed image data is now what's cached over raw responses
this is moreso to cut down on network requests while i'm working on the overlay, as i forcibly disable caching. some things (like static images) really need to continue being cached though
fixed emotes failing to fetch if broadcaster has a 7TV account but does not have an active emote set
fixed !refreshpfp not refreshing the user's avatar correctly
set the overlay system's avatar to a static image
for some reason createImageBitmap fails on SVG blobs, but not URLs pointing to SVG files??? what
fixed private BTTV channel emotes overwriting public emotes added to the channel
fixed users that only have 1 bit badges sometimes failing to have any messages appear
avatars that are PNGs now remain cached as a PNG internally
avatar display permissions now reflect changes on previously sent messages
avatar background effect toggle now reflects the setting's state on previously sent messages
removed an extra avatar background element being created that was never actually used
removed animation delay on in-animations for message blocks as it's now pretty much waiting on data to be received before actually rendering things to the DOM now
FFZ and twitch emotes are now cached internally
fixed animated FFZ emotes not animating
cached avatars now expire after a week, or if the current avatar size setting doesn't match up with the cached avatar size
each primary section of the sidebar is now a collapsable submenu
for those of you who don't use the chat overlay but use other pieces of the overlay suite, this should make things a bit cleaner for y'all :)
reordered some sections within setting pages
added a button to clear cached avatars in the chat's avatars tab
added a button to clear cached emotes in the chat's emotes tab
updated datapuller support to use the new internal cover art and level id fields
added the new level ID's from the Daft Punk pack to the OST/DLC list
avatars are now cached locally using the CacheStorage API
looking into a way i can get emotes to use this too, it's a little... more complicated
functions that fetch emote data are now asynchronous
they were still using jquery ajax calls, meant to get around to updating that and never did woops
version checking function was made asynchronous
fixed various minor aesthetic issues with the previous update
rewrote some stuff to use the new normalized data schema
mapper metadata from BeatSaver can now be shown over internal mapper metadata
added support for BeatSaver map collaborators
(for now this is making 2 API calls to BeatSaver, as the maps/hash endpoint doesn't contain collaborator metadata yet)
avatars will no longer show for suspended BeatSaver users regardless of user verification status, map rank status, or map curation status
cover images fetched from BeatSaver are now resized to double the cover art size and cached locally while an active session lasts
on base game maps, the mapper field now includes which pack the map is from
DataPuller does not expose any information i can use to show this, so (for now?) this is only for BS+
secondary metadata now scrolls if its width extends beyond the parent container's bounds
forced removal of font variants on textual parts of the overlay
::DROPOUT::'s third colon character appeared to be misaligned while testing and it bothered me. see what i mean?
rewrote some stuff to use the new normalized data schema
revision data is now internally tracked (woops)
secondary metadata now scrolls if its width extends beyond the parent container's bounds
this is actually really rough at the moment and i'll probably just end up re-doing the markup/layout later on. my head hurts
musicbrainz release data that doesn't contain a date string is now skipped when determining which release to use for extraneous data
to whomever contributed a release to Porter Robinson's "Unfold" without a release date: wtf >:(
forced removal of font variants on textual parts of the overlay
moved state fetching timer retriggering towards the beginning of the state response callback function to prevent hangups if something within said callback function throws an error
removed IP settings for external beat saber connections and forced IP settings to localhost
none of the mods that expose websocket connections support websockets over SSL, meaning only localhost and anything in 127.0.0.0/8 are the only valid settings
if in the future someone needs a setting to force a wss connection via their own ws->wss proxy, shoot me a message and i'll add a setting when the need comes
incoming data from the datapuller beat saber mod can now be used instead of incoming data from bs+'s song overlay module for beat saber related overlays
both are normalized to a new internal schema, using datapuller won't offer any new features. it is simply an alternative
updated pronouns to use alejo's new API
if you haven't looked in a while, you can now set the secondary pronoun manually
removed old pronoun classes
deprecated settings for pronoun tags specifically and added a setting to change the separator instead
added a setting to draw the background below the actual overlay
fixed additional weight on the combo counter not loading on new sessions
made pause state logic make more sense, also made sure the pause effect doesn't "stick" if turning it off while the game is paused
fixed secondary metadata triggering fade animations any time a game scene change happened, regardless if it needed to refresh it or not
reverted change of multiple border-radius CSS declarations on scannable elements
in-browser these declarations weren't necessary, but in OBS this was adding a bit of a brighter halo around corners of the scannable
moved shadow class further into the DOM on scannables
fixed musicbrainz release sorting not actually doing anything
most of the time (not all the time) it was sorted by oldest release first direct from the API, didn't catch this until flipping songs back and forth
release year can now be shown alongside album information
musicbrainz data will override spotify's information if it's present, spotify's information sometimes pertains to when the song was put on the platform and not it's actual release date
moved automatic dark/light color variable setters to the settings panel
borders can now be rendered on scannables
fixed art outline backgrounds being misaligned on the right-aligned layout
added a setting to draw the background below the actual overlay
couple of default settings were changed
colors following cover art now update when playing a track after pausing
fixed duplicate rows being added for non-chat overlay settings if the sidebar was collapsed
fixed non-chat settings being sent to the chat overlay's settings handler
fixed duplicate BS+ connections triggering on reload of beat saber related overlays while in a disconnected state
attempted to fix scannables sometimes failing to appear
i wasn't able to replicate the bug i was running into on stream in my dev environment, but i'm hoping moving the on load trigger's DOM element outside of the scannable wrapper will fix this
scannables should now auto-hide on load failure
cover art should now show the placeholder cover on load failure
fixed state fetching triggering a new vibrant call on cover art every time it fetched player state
didn't catch this issue initially until i did some deeper digging for other things, woops. i think this was loading from cache at least. i hope.
vibrant failing to fetch cover art no longer stops the fetch timer
this will also force both light/dark colors to the default background color
cover art is now shrunk on a canvas element equal to double of the set art size and base64-encoded to avoid duplicate GET requests on cover art fetching
switched from jpeg scannables to (modified) svg scannables
i don't... think spotify mentions the svg format anywhere? found this out through a stackoverflow question
removed some css formatting on scannables since they're actually transparent now
based SVG format
fixed duplicate scannable fetching, as loading in CSS and DOM elements are separate
it now just base64 encodes a single fetch response and uses that in both CSS and the DOM element
state fetching now properly handles HTTP status code 204 if no active spotify instances are available
song publishers/labels can now be shown alongside album information (fetched via MusicBrainz)

it has been 6 years since spotify said "yeah! sure! we'll get around to adding this in our API!" so clearly they're not adding it (https://github.com/spotify/web-api/issues/779#issuecomment-413182817)
oauth token code flows were made asynchronous
i wasn't yet in the async mindset when initially coding all of that, a lot of promise catching was simplified
increased setting label and input divider width to 2px
added user agent string to the bottom of the about panel
the out-of-date warning notification now lasts 2 minutes instead of 10 seconds
clicking notifications now dismisses them
decreased default remote data fetching timeout from 7 seconds to 4 seconds
added placeholder data for map metadata fields left blank by mappers
hiding the overlay when not playing a map can now be toggled
default font now properly loads (my bad)
added horizontal alignment settings to relevant parts of the overlay
added some additional font settings to some portions of the overlay
removed outside margins on elements
forgot a box shadow class on cover art for initial view of the overlay
minimum width settings can now be changed in the about tab
the sidebar can now be collapsed to save some horizontal space
removed permanent invite link to my discord as it's no longer valid
if i still need to be reached via discord, simply shoot me a message request
7TV emote sets now automatically update
!refreshemotes should no longer be required for anything but FFZ emotes now
moved some leftover jquery get calls in the !bsr command over to the fetch API
fixed user customizable name colors not applying on previously sent messages with default settings once changed
fixed resetting user customizable chat settings not appearing to do anything
new beat saber overlay is ready enough for public use yippee
https://theblackparrot.me/overlays/bs
updated to work with new data schemas
added a setting to automatically determine scannable foreground color based on the background color's brightness
fixed variable/setting resets still triggering on dev timestamps
fixed some setting elements rendering way wider than they needed to be
horizontal scrolling shouldn't be an issue now yw
enforced a minimum width of 500px on the main part of the panel
fixed arrows having too much padding on the left
normalized setting measurement element margins
almost completely restructured the data schemas and flow of beat saber plus data
added icons for beat saber related overlays
removed alpha values from default color values if the default was fully opaque
the color picker polyfill i'm using removes it if it's not transparent at all, which caused some reset button issues
fixed user info culling always triggering on right-aligned layouts, also simplified the width check function
fixed radial gradient 7tv paints (usually) only showing half the paint
announcements can now be tagged messages
fixed abyss falloff on avatar background blur effects
never added a default value for avatar background blurring, woops
adjusted default amount of padding on avatar backgrounds
removed outline/shadow effects on avatar background effects
tried for a while to get these to show up again after the new changes were made to no avail, sorry
removed setting for avatar background magnification, as it's now automatic
adjusted more default settings (sorry weh)
fixed CEF-audio-bug-workaround-noise playing even if it's disabled when the overlay loads
re-did how cover art background offsets were being calculated
abysses were appearing on the outer edges of the background element if the blurring amount got too high, the width and height will now auto-adjust dependent on blur amount
removed background effect offset settings
they were there to address the abyss issue but this is now auto-fixed so it's not needed anymore
added a setting to toggle the gradient mask on the background
added a setting to ensure automatic colors are between set brightness levels
added placeholder cover art when no song data is present
added the ability to reset specific settings values on settings panel updates
this'll only be used if i'm changing the way the values function, things won't be reset if it just "looks better"
added a setting to alternate horizontal alignment of message blocks
lowered some default values on settings to condense the overlay a bit
simplified some of the default block appear/decay animations
added support for watch streak messages
holy crap twitch PLEASE update your IRC docs
chat messages can now be delayed (for automatic moderation purposes/etc)
i have this defaulted to 2 seconds, should hardly be noticeable
fixed minutes not being padded with a leading zero if the setting to pad the leading value is off and hours are present
changed the way the clock switches shown values, should fix cases where it fails to continue its loop
increased default clock width to accommodate the 12-hour format
fixed clock disappearing if the settings panel is refreshed
forced timestamp of 9999999999999 to show "(in progress)" for its patch notes header
this timestamp is in the year 2280, it will never be hit. this also only ever shows on the dev path, so.
updated font awesome from 5.15 to 6.5
added a setting to force background color on scannables
scannable URLs are now generated on the overlay side
...why did i even make the settings panel do this wtf
changed the way scannables are being rendered
it'll no longer have to fetch a new scannable image any time colors change
reworded the setting to switch the foreground scannable color to denote switching between automatic light/dark background colors
if song data has been fetched before, it's now sent out immediately upon the overlay announcing its presence
art outlines now blur a slightly zoomed in cover art rather than just showing it directly
cover art with borders made the outlines look ugly and it's been bothering me
cover art can now be used as a background for the overlay
fixed marquee scrolling on title text if it's too long on the initial load
adjusted some default settings
channel point reward redemptions can now be shown as an event tag if the redemption has text associated with it
fixed incorrect cache location of the known bots list data
fixed BTTV badges failing to render if user object hasn't completely initialized yet
can now show local time, stream uptime, and ad countdown
overall element width can now be forced
useful if more than 1 time value is shown
alignment of text can now be changed
clock header cases can now be forced
fixed 12am showing as 0am on 12-hour formats
switched out the header text override setting for a string variable
use %zi to show timezone initials, %zo to show timezone offset relative to GMT, and %zn to show the full timezone name in any of the clock/timer headers
added authorization code grant flow auth to twitch to allow for additional data scopes
some new functionality may not work without connecting to twitch in this way, everything up to this point should remain unchanged as none of it requires this authentication flow

there's also a related setting in the Connections tab that you must manually enable to allow for these additional data points to work. i'm forcing these to give nothing back initially as the API tokens have to be owned by the same account you're trying to access, otherwise they don't work

i've also run into an issue (once) where sometimes things just catastrophically break and the panel continuously reloads because of a token error? i've added a button to the about panel in case things happen (it should be fine though, i think)
clarified what data scopes are being obtained and for what reasons in the authentication tab
i love transparency, transparency is great
re-organized the authentication tab a bit
made the bullet points in list elements dashes
fixed some issues with new setup initialization
un-hardcoded a delay on fetching data for new spotify songs playing
this was added in to ensure a new song is playing after the currently playing one finishes so the quicker refresh doesn't misfire, was hardcoded at 500ms
migrated audio fetching functions to async equivalents
migrated calls to twitch's helix API to async equivalents
moved avatar permission checking into the user class as a getter function
added support for custom bit badges
i meant to add in support for this forever ago but never got around to it, woops
custom sub and bit badges can now be toggled
internal badge list is now an object instead of an array
twitch sends this out as an array still and i have, no idea why
messages that have a custom channel point redemption attached to them can now be hidden
properly support default sub badge variants
fixed 7TV paints and badges failing to apply if the user is still being initialized
fixed 7TV badges not showing up if the user has no other badges
adjusted default margin on international names
removed delay on applying settings when the overlay loads up
(update only contains new settings)
began work on migrating various data objects to classes
emotes, user data, and external cosmetics/badges are fully migrated at this point
began work on turning callback-hell functions into asynchronous functions
changed the way sub badge fetching was being executed
condensed some internal for loops
user data cache is no longer stored in SessionStorage, as it'll now only execute data fetches when it sees users for the first time
was kinda pointless since most overlay use is just 1 session anyways
badges from external services and badges added by the overlay itself can now be instantly toggled
updated some of the badge categories with some of the newer badges that've been released
also added an "Event-based" category (for the r/place and recap badges only right now)
added support for chat announcements
for now they'll just mimic highlighted messages, may look into announcement formatting in the future
moved settings to toggle external emotes out of the data fetching functions
it now determines if emotes are "enabled" through a custom getter in the new emote class when messages are being parsed
smoothed outline shadows out if outline size exceeds 1px
added a setting to use the prominent avatar color as a name color fallback instead of the defined default
added the ability to add borders to badges
avatars and pronouns now update on all previous message blocks after using either of the refresh commands
de-broadcaster'd the test messages
(update only contains new settings)
if a track ends before the next state fetch is triggered, it will now trigger early
increased the state refresh interval's default from 5 seconds to 15 seconds
this and the above change should heavily lower API requests at the cost of pausing feeling a little less snappy. would highly recommend resetting this setting to the new default
fixed the track progress outline sometimes showing 100% even after new track data is fetched
added a setting to toggle displaying if an album is a single
cached spotify authentication tokens can now be manually cleared if a manual re-auth is needed
fixed buttons needing a confirmation click not displaying icons after letting the confirmation click expire
ensured buttons needing a confirmation click have a static width set
changed spotify "artist" settings to "secondary metadata" settings
they also apply to the album information, so this just makes more sense
fixed shadow effects clipping on the left side of text
scannable height is now a fixed, static setting
this also fixes "lines" appearing below scannables if some other part's height exceeds the scannable's height
merged line height settings from the title and artist elements into one setting
added setting to right-align the overlay's layout
added setting to flip the order of artist/album and title elements
added setting to change the brightness value of the cover art outline
minor default settings tweaks
(update only contains new settings)

strengthened word filtering a bit, will now strip out non letter-characters, and reduce characters with any sort of accent marks to ascii-compliant characters and attempt to find words within the stripped string

(again, these filters are only there to prevent user-defined words from directly appearing on the overlay, there will always be a way to work around it, but it will involve messing the word up in some fashion now)
added a toggle for !bsr output
simplified the way text outline effects are being rendered
to restore the effect back to something that looked like it did before this change, set your outline effects color to a fully opaque black. the default has been adjusted
tweaked some default settings slightly
split the word censors into harder filters and only specific-word filters
the shorter f and n slurs were triggering false positives on the new system, it's *highly advised* to reset those settings to the new defaults
apparently i never added the default international name settings?
uh, woops
added an option to display the album/compilation a song is on
will fade between the artist and the album/comp on a loop (configurable)
added a toggle for animations
removed unnecessary condition check in state fetching
moved filter effects from parent wrapper elements to the text elements themselves
simplified the way text outline effects are being rendered
now configurable through the settings panel
timezone data now fetched through Luxon, timezone abbreviations should now be automatic for everyone
header can now be forced to show user-defined text
leading zero character on the hour display can now be toggled
added support for 12-hour time format
added a primary color setting specifically for the settings panel in the about tab
meh, why not /shrug
re-arranged the about tab a bit
tweaked the overall theme "just a bit"
added a button to reset each specific setting back to defaults if the setting is not set to the default value
overlay will now hide itself when paused (can be turned off)
gradients can now be drawn over scannables
this may make the scannables harder for spotify apps to read if the gradient applied is too strong, use with caution
added border radius setting for scannables
added border radius setting for cover art
i forgor to un-hardcode these my bad
removed setting for scannable width
updates to how scannables are being rendered in the DOM makes dealing with this setting a lot more of a headache, it'll now just fill available space
changelogs are now shown in the new Updates tab
removed critical flag on most of the spotify settings
settings pertaining to functionality will remain marked as critical
